Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different types of habitats, such as a playground, garden, forest, pond, or lake.
The student can include different kinds of living things in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, or fish.
The student can show a variety of animals in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, or clams.
The student can compare and contrast the different living things found in at least two different habitats.
The student can observe and draw patterns of where plants and animals live and how they vary from one habitat to another.
